title: Backend modular monolith scaffold spec
description: Draft initial backend module layout and interfaces for auth, world, economy, and combat under a single service deployable.
acceptance_criteria: Module boundaries and interfaces listed
M1 bootstrap implementation steps defined
Assumptions and deferred decisions documented
last_failure_reason: Codex CLI command not found: codex
requeue_reason: Requeued after Codex CLI Windows bootstrap fixes and backlog cleanup

title: Run browser-based visual smoke pass for M1 client shell breakpoints
description: Execute the documented manual checklist for the client shell at desktop/tablet/mobile widths and confirm placeholder-art-only compliance with screenshots or notes.
acceptance_criteria: Manual verification checklist in agents/tomas-grell/manual-verification-rk-m1-0008.md is executed in a browser
Responsive behavior at >=1221px, 861-1220px, and <=860px is recorded with pass/fail notes
Placeholder-art policy compliance is explicitly confirmed or violations are logged
blocker_reason: - `agents/tomas-grell/outbox.json`: appended blocked run summary and structured follow-up task for daemon ingestion.

title: Add first-slice upgrade and train command handlers
description: Add backend handlers for one building upgrade and one unit train action using starter tables, including structured success/fail outcomes and placeholder event keys.
acceptance_criteria: At least one building upgrade and one unit training command handler are implemented for first-slice IDs
Each handler returns structured results with `insufficient_resources`, `cooldown`, and `invalid_state` failure cases
Successful results emit placeholder event keys compatible with existing feed wiring and without combat/diplomacy dependencies

title: Add automated a11y and mobile viewport smoke checks for client shell
description: Add a lightweight browser-based smoke test (keyboard tab sequence + focus-visible assertions + 360px/390px viewport snapshots) for the client shell wireframe so future UI changes do not regress accessibility or mobile usability.
acceptance_criteria: Automated check runs the client shell at 360px and 390px widths and verifies no horizontal overflow on the main shell container
Keyboard navigation test covers region tab activation and confirms visible focus styling on representative controls
Reduced-motion mode test confirms region navigation does not request smooth scrolling
last_blocker_reason: Repeated failure: ERROR: {"detail":"The 'codex-5.3' model is not supported when using Codex with a ChatGPT account."}

title: Treat frontend visual `STATUS: BLOCKED` validation results as block-state outcomes
description: Adjust validation result handling so environment blockers reported by `tools/frontend_visual_smoke.py` (`STATUS: BLOCKED`) mark work items blocked with actionable reason instead of repeatedly retrying/escalating as generic validation failures.
acceptance_criteria: Frontend validation runs that return `STATUS: BLOCKED` are recorded as blocked with blocker reason containing the visual smoke error summary
Retry count is not incremented for environmental blockers and no new retry-threshold escalation is created from that condition
Regression coverage demonstrates this behavior while preserving existing failure semantics for real visual regressions

title: Scaffold Steam wrapper packaging lane using Tauri default
description: Set up an initial Steam-targeted desktop wrapper path around the web client using the documented Tauri-first strategy, with reproducible build/run commands and deferred Steamworks/native integrations.
acceptance_criteria: A Tauri-based wrapper scaffold is added for Windows-first packaging of the web vertical-slice artifact
Wrapper docs/scripts define repeatable local run and packaged build commands without requiring Steamworks feature integration
Store/build placeholders (icon/capsule/metadata) are explicitly marked temporary and final art is not a blocker
blocker_reason: Note: there are unrelated pre-existing/daemon-updated working tree changes outside this task (left untouched).

title: Scaffold Android wrapper packaging lane using Capacitor default
description: Set up an initial Android packaging path around the web client via Capacitor/WebView with deterministic sync/build/run steps, touch-safe baseline configuration, and placeholder-only mobile store assets.
acceptance_criteria: A Capacitor/WebView wrapper scaffold is added with repeatable commands to sync web assets and produce an Android debug/release package
Wrapper configuration covers first-slice essentials (back button/orientation/safe-area baseline) without adding new game mechanics
Android icon/splash/store metadata are placeholder-only and explicitly non-blocking for final art
blocker_reason: - Appended `RK-AUTO-PLATFORM-0001-F03` completion entry with blocker note and one structured follow-up in `proposed_work_items` (daemon guard validation for Android wrapper preparation).

title: Gate platform lane with packaged web artifact smoke validation
description: Add daemon validation hooks for platform-owned web packaging items so deterministic package build and packaged-artifact smoke commands run automatically before completion.
acceptance_criteria: Platform validation can run `python tools/web_vertical_slice_packaging.py package --clean` automatically for matching work items
Platform validation can run `python tools/web_vertical_slice_packaging.py smoke` against the produced artifact
Blocked/success outcomes are surfaced in daemon command-result summaries
blocker_reason: Note: pre-existing daemon/backlog changes in `coordination/backlog/work-items.json` and `coordination/backlog/completed-items.json` were left untouched.

title: Wire loop namespaced outcome keys into client key selection
description: Add support for `event.tick.*`, `event.build.*`, `event.train.*`, and `event.scout.*` keys in client shell/event panel lookups with fallback to existing module keys.
acceptance_criteria: Client renders at least one `tick` outcome via a `event.tick.*` key
Client renders at least one `build`, `train`, and `scout` outcome via the new loop namespace keys
Existing module keys remain supported until full migration is complete
blocker_reason: Frontend visual smoke blocked by environment: playwright import failed: No module named 'playwright'

title: Wire new loop outcome keys into event feed rendering pipeline
description: Map new `event.tick.*`, `event.build.*`, `event.train.*`, and `event.scout.*` keys to rendering tokens/strings in the client so both success and failure flow variants are visible in the event feed UI.
acceptance_criteria: At least one `event.tick.*` success and one failure template renders correctly in the feed
At least one `event.build.*` failure template renders with dynamic tokens for missing resources or cooldown
At least one `event.train.*` failure template renders with dynamic tokens for cooldown or invalid state
Scout outcomes remain backward-compatible with `event.scout.dispatched`, `event.scout.report_empty`, and `event.scout.report_hostile`
blocker_reason: Frontend visual smoke blocked by environment: playwright import failed: No module named 'playwright'

title: Apply micro-pass rally cost delta and re-run RK-M1-0006-F02-F01-F02
description: Apply narrow rally_post-only cost deltas and rerun the 30m/2h/6h reference simulation to validate rally_post reaches L1 by 6h.
acceptance_criteria: rally_post cost values updated to `rally_post.cost_food_l1: 64 -> 55`, `rally_post.cost_wood_l1: 64 -> 33`, and `rally_post.cost_stone_l1: 52 -> 52`
30m/2h/6h checkpoint tables are refreshed after the micro candidate is applied
Rally_post reaches L1 by or before 6h in the re-run
blocker_reason: If you want, I can prepare the next smallest rally-only candidate set next and append it as a concrete follow-up item for immediate re-run.

title: Apply narrow rally_post cost-only micro-pass and rerun KPIs
description: Apply only rally_post L1 cost reductions to reach rally_post by 6h without introducing new mechanics, then re-run RK-M1-0006-F02-F01-F01-F01 acceptance checks.
acceptance_criteria: Only rally_post L1 costs are changed in `backend/src/modules/buildings/infra/seeds/v1/building-lines.json`
Proposed values: cost_food_l1 70->55, cost_wood_l1 70->33, cost_stone_l1 remains at 52-equivalent target band
Re-run 30m/2h/6h checkpoints and confirm `rally_post` reaches L1 by 6h
No additional mechanics, multipliers, or non-rally building values are changed
